title: Processes - Diff Eq Separation of Variables

content.question: Let <math alttext="y equals, f of x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> be the particular solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 y plus 1, end fraction " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with the initial condition <math alttext="y of 0, equals 0 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following gives an expression for <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and the domain for which the solution is valid?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator e raised to the 2 x power, minus 1, and denominator 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for all <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, tangent x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="the negative of the fraction pi over 2, less than x, less than the fraction pi over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the square root of x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator negative 1, plus the square root of 1 plus 4 x, end root, and denominator 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x greater than negative one fourth" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator negative 1, plus the square root of 1 plus 4 x, end root, and denominator 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x greater than negative one fourth" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
